item.title: This week Sanctuary4All Colorado is raising money for the First...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

This week Sanctuary4All Colorado is raising money for the First Unitarian Society of Denver, the church that has hosted the Solidarity Meals program for the last year. All of the money raised this week will go toward the church as a thanks for the space provided for the program. Pickup is in Denver at the church, 1400 N. Lafayette Street from 1PM to 3PM. Order your flautas now! https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co

Sanctuary4All Colorado is in Denver, Colorado.

This week we‚Äôre raising money for the First Unitarian Society of Denver, the church that has hosted the Solidarity Meals program for the last year. All of he mo...ney raised this week will go toward the church as a thanks to the space they‚Äôve done graciously offered us. You can order flautas at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co

item.title: Tania is selling cheese enchiladas this Saturday July 31st with...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Tania is selling cheese enchiladas this Saturday July 31st with Sanctuary4All Colorado Solidarity Meals! There will also be agua fresca (watermelon water) and dessert available to purchase at pickup. All the funds go directly to impacted families. Pickup is in Denver at 1400 N. Lafayette St. from 1PM to 3PM. Place your orders now! https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co/ Please follow Sanctuary4All Colorado to learn more about how you can support their amazing work.

item.title: Gaby is selling burritos for $7 this Saturday July 24th with...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Gaby is selling burritos for $7 this Saturday July 24th with Sanctuary4All Colorado Solidarity Meals! Pickup is in Denver from 1PM to 3PM. All funds will go directly to Gaby and her family. Stock up and place your orders now https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co

De Rajas - A vegetarian burrito filled with peppers, beans & cheese

De Fajitas de Pollo - A chicken burrito filled peppers & cheese

Sanctuary4All Colorado is in Denver, Colorado.

Gaby is selling burritos this weekend for $7! Stock up instead of meal prepping. You can order at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co
item.author: SURJ Denver

item.title: Place your order for this Saturday's Solidarity Meals 7/17...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Place your order for this Saturday's Solidarity Meals 7/17 - pickup in Denver from 1PM to 3PM with Sanctuary4All Colorado. Yessenia is selling her delicious pupusas AND flan! All of the funds raised go directly to Yessenia and her family who have been fighting their immigration cases since 2011. Place your orders today! https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co.

Frijol con Queso ($3.50) - A thick flatbread made with masa & stuffed with beans & cheese. Served with curtido & salsa roja.
Chicharron con Queso ($3.50) - A thick flatbread made with masa & stuffed with chicharrones & cheese. Served with curtido & salsa roja.
Flan ($5)- A creamy baked custard dessert topped with caramel.

translation in English follows. La familia Blanco Mart√≠nez ha estado luchando desde el 2011 con migraci√≥n y hasta la fecha no se define nada a√∫n en su caso, est...amos en resistencia con estas leyes que cambian constantemente es por eso que estamos pidiendo de tu apoyo y aportaci√≥n con comidas solidarias a la familia para seguir luchando con nuestros abogados para poder seguir en este pa√≠s tan bendecido

The Blanco Mart√≠nez family has been fighting ICE since 2011 and still hasn‚Äôt found clarity in their immigration case. We are resisting laws that are constantly changing, which is why we‚Äôre asking for your support and contribution through solidarity meals so that our family can keep fighting alongside our lawyers to be able to stay in this country. We‚Äôre so grateful.

https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co

item.title: Lupe is selling gorditas and chile Colorado this week for...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Lupe is selling gorditas and chile Colorado this week for Sanctuary4All Colorado's solidarity meals!

Gorditas are vegetarian (filled with green peppers and cheese) - $15, and chile Colorado is pork in red adobo chile sauce, also $15, both served with a side of rice and beans.

Pickup is ONLY in Denver, this Saturday (July 10th) from 1-3 PM....
Venmo: @guadalupe-carmona-4

Order at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co!

See MoreSanctuary4All Colorado is in Denver, Colorado.

Guadalupe will be bringing a delicious new dish this Saturday, grab some chile colorado for lunch to support her fight. Order at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co
item.author: SURJ Denver

item.title: Stop by in solidarity of detained trans migrants and catch a...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Stop by in solidarity of detained trans migrants and catch a fabulous drag show! Today at 6pm at 19th and Stout.

‚ÄéPadres & J√≥venes Unidos‚Äé to No Pride in Detention: Street Drag Action

üö®HAPPENING TODAYüö® ARE YOU ALL READY TO KICK OFF PRIDE WITH A PROTEST AND DRAG SHOW?! ‚ú®üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà

Join us and in honoring the lives of Roxana, Johana, and Victoria who... died in ICE custody.

We are calling for the release of currently detained trans people & people living with HIV & medical conditions, and to ensure that trans people have the resources to live safely after being released post detention. We demand they have access to safe housing and employment so they can survive and thrive.

THERE IS NOT PRIDE IN DETENTION! ‚úäüèº

Performances by:
‚ú® Regina D Staxx‚ú®
‚ú® Alexis Staxx‚ú®

item.author: SURJ Denver

item.title: Pablo from Sanctuary4All Colorado is selling Pollo Asada this...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Pablo from Sanctuary4All Colorado is selling Pollo Asada this Saturday! This delicious roast chicken is served with salad and mashed potatoes. Pickup is in Denver from 1PM-3PM. Please read more about Pablo's story below and show him some support by ordering pollo asada. https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co

Pablo was first detained at the GEO detention center in January of 2020. That summer, he advocated not only for his release but the release of everyone detained due to the... risk of a large COVID outbreak at GEO. His advocacy helped lead to COVID testing for all detainees (the Aurora detention center was one of the first in the country to provide testing), but he also faced retaliation. He was threatened with deportation, thrown in solitary, and eventually moved to Teller county, where he was isolated from his family and community. Pablo was recently released, and is still fighting his deportation case.

Sanctuary4All Colorado","interactionStatistic":[{"\u0040type":"InteractionCounter","interactionType":"https:\/\/schema.org\/CommentAction","userInteractionCount":0},{"\u0040type":"InteractionCounter","interactionType":"http:\/\/schema.org\/LikeAction","userInteractionCount":0},{"\u0040type":"InteractionCounter","interactionType":"http:\/\/schema.org\/ShareAction","userInteractionCount":0},{"\u0040type":"InteractionCounter","interactionType":"http:\/\/schema.org\/FollowAction","userInteractionCount":2120}],"commentCount":0,"author":{"\u0040type":"Organization","name":"Sanctuary4All Colorado","identifier":2370109659944620,"url":"https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/Sanctuary4AllCO\/","image":"https:\/\/scontent.fapa1-2.fna.fbcdn.net\/v\/t1.6435-1\/234403665_2978605375761709_5643493151561385051_n.jpg?_nc_cat=105&ccb=1-5&_nc_sid=a12de3&_nc_ohc=WTT2lEpphSoAX_O-HQc&_nc_ht=scontent.fapa1-2.fna&oh=23057ccd535cb6966138a2b5dd2a0d86&oe=6142AB03","sameAs":"https:\/\/sanctuary4all.co\/","foundingDate":"2019-07-17T13:26:13-0700"},"image":[{"\u0040type":"ImageObject","width":960,"contentUrl":"https:\/\/scontent.fapa1-2.fna.fbcdn.net\/v\/t1.6435-9\/p960x960\/204877049_2944585545830359_2595494820399456375_n.jpg?_nc_cat=105&ccb=1-5&_nc_sid=9e2e56&_nc_ohc=VRT2uTgvL0oAX9xH37t&_nc_ht=scontent.fapa1-2.fna&oh=73f79f8dc57f2a79ac6c75b7d1337c74&oe=61433613","caption":""}]}Sanctuary4All Colorado is at GEO Aurora Ice Processing Center. ¬∑ Aurora

Pablo was first detained at the GEO detention center in January of 2020. That summer, he advocated not only for his release but he release of everyone detained ...due to the risk of a large COVID outbreak at GEO. His advocacy helped lead to COVID testing for all detainees (the Aurora detention center was one of the first in the country to provide testing), but he also faced retaliation. He was threatened with deportation, thrown in solitary, and eventually moved to Teller county, where he was isolated from his family and community. Pablo was recently released, and is still fighting his deportation case. You can help support him by ordering pollo asada from him at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co.

item.author: SURJ Denver

item.title: JOIN US FOR A STREET DRAG ACTION TO #ENDTRANSDETENTION ON JUNE...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

JOIN US FOR A STREET DRAG ACTION TO #ENDTRANSDETENTION ON JUNE 24TH AT 6 PM!!

Come enjoy a street drag show to honor Victoria Arellano, Roxsana Hernandez, and Johana Medina, who are three trans women who died because of ICE negligence.

We are demanding that the Biden administration ensures trans people have the resources to live safely after being released post detention, including access to safe housing and employment so that trans people can survive and thrive.

...

Make a difference this Pride, and join us in celebrating our existence as trans and queer people THURSDAY, JUNE 24TH!

Performances by:

‚ú® Regina D. StaxXx ‚ú®

‚ú® Alexis StaxXx ‚ú®

~~~En Espa√±ol~~~

Ven a disfrutar de un espect√°culo callejero de drag en homenaje a Victoria Arellano, Roxsana Hernandez y Johana Medina, quienes son tres mujeres trans que murieron por negligencia intencional de ICE.

Exigimos que la administraci√≥n de Biden garantice que las personas trans tengan los recursos para vivir de manera segura despu√©s de ser liberadas despu√©s de la detenci√≥n, incluido el acceso a una vivienda y un empleo seguros para que las personas trans puedan sobrevivir y prosperar.

¬°Marca la diferencia en este mes del Orgullo y √∫nete a nosotros para celebrar nuestra existencia como personas trans y cuir EL PR√ìXIMO JUEVES 24 DE JUNIO!

Shows Por:

‚ú® Regina D. StaxXx ‚ú®

‚ú® Alexis StaxXx ‚ú®

See More

THU, JUN 24

No Pride in Detention: Street Drag Action

1961 Stout St, Denver, CO 80202, United StatesCauses ¬∑ 276 people
item.author: SURJ Denver

item.title: This Juneteenth you can go beyond the hollow gestures of the...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

This Juneteenth you can go beyond the hollow gestures of the federal government and make a difference by supporting students attending the 5280 Freedom School. As we have seen again and again, the fight to keep students from learning the truth of our past and how it correlates to dangerous behaviors and ideologies is alive and well today. By donating this Juneteenth you are supporting students with gaining access and knowledge to crucial information that our current system f...ails to teach students that uplifts them and makes them confident and powerful.

BLM 5280 has one week left for all donations to be matched by Moonshot edVentures, so support today and make Juneteenth more than the bare minimum and paid time off; make a difference in students‚Äô education.

To Donate:
1. Go to https://www.moonshotedventures.org/shoot-for-the-moon-donat‚Ä¶
2. Select your donation amount
3. Under "DESIGNATION", scroll down to select "Black Lives Matter 5280 Freedom School"
4. Enter your payment and contact information
5. Click "Donate One Time"

See MoreBlack Lives Matter 5280

It's almost #Juneteenth weekend! We invite you to celebrate with reparative actions by donating to our year-round freedom school at shoot4themoon.org. Help us r...each our goal of $10k with matched donations until June 25th! #moonshot #shootforthemoon2021 #denver #education #diverseleaders #leadersofcolor #colorado #diversityandinclusion #diversitydenver #entrepreneurship #entrepreneursofcolor #womenentrepreneurship #socialjustice #socialjusticeeducation #educationequity #impact #community #leadership #innovators #innovation #changeagents #equalitynow #racialequality #genderequality

See More
item.author: SURJ Denver

item.title: Lupe from Sanctuary4All Colorado is selling gorditas this...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Lupe from Sanctuary4All Colorado is selling gorditas this Saturday, either vegetarian (de rajas con queso) or pork green chile, both are $14 for 2 gorditas served with rice, beans, curtido, and salsa.

Pickup in Denver & Boulder from 1-3 PM.
Order at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co.
Venmo @guadalupe-carmona-4

...

Lupe was in a car accident while on her way to visit her husband, who is currently detained in Texas and will likely soon be deported. The money raised through gordita sales will go toward supporting her family and getting a new car so that she can continue working.

**100% of proceeds raised go directly back to impacted families**.

See MoreSanctuary4All Colorado is in Denver, Colorado.

Lupe is selling gorditas this Saturday. She was in a car accident recently while on her way to visit her husband, who is currently detained in Texas and will li...kely soon be deported. The money raised through gordita sales will go toward supporting her family and getting a new car so that she can continue working. You can support by ordering at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co

item.author: SURJ Denver

item.title: As we announced a few weeks ago, SURJ Denver is raising funds to...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

As we announced a few weeks ago, SURJ Denver is raising funds to pay our friends at Celestial Alegr√≠a to develop a 10-week intensive political education and racial equity training to be delivered this September 2021. Thanks to those who have donated so far - likes and shares are also appreciated!

Meet the first of two consultants who will be paid to develop this curriculum as well as oversee and coach the DSURJ facilitation team!

Celest√© Martinez, founder and owner of Celesti...al Alegr√≠a, is committed to developing trainings that build conditions and skills that foster personal and collective development in anti-racism. She's chosen to work with DSURJ because we're committed to working within white communities to implement structural changes and practices that truly further racial equity.

Our fundraising goal is $7,000, 100% of which will go directly to Celestial Alegr√≠a consultants as payment for developing this curriculum. Any additional funds raised will be used for scholarships to help defray costs for fall workshop attendees.
_________________________
Donate:
1. Through Denver SURJ‚Äôs fiscal sponsor Centro Humanitario Para Los Trabajadores (please add a note ‚ÄúFor Denver SURJ Ed Fundraiser‚Äù -- this donation is tax deductible) via:
-Their Colorado Gives page: https://www.coloradogives.org/index.php...
-Their PayPal: http://paypal.me/CentroHumanitario
2. To @surjdenver on Venmo (please add a note ‚ÄúFor Denver SURJ Ed Fundraiser"). NOTE: any funds donated via Venmo will be transferred to El Centro monthly. While this method is easier, because it does not go through El Centro, it is not tax deductible, and you will not receive a donation letter or receipt from El Centro.
3. Sign up to express your interest and which of the days/times would be preferable (and let us know if you donated!): https://forms.gle/HugNq4JcgUMN49Fu8
_________________

Please like and follow Celestial Alegr√≠a, contribute to their Reparations Network, and stay tuned!

See More
item.author: SURJ Denver

item.title: Yessenia from Sanctuary4All Colorado is selling tamales de rajas...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Yessenia from Sanctuary4All Colorado is selling tamales de rajas con queso and panes con pollo (a Salvadoran specialty!) this weekend!

Her tamales are wrapped in banana leaves, which means they‚Äôre a little bit bigger than the tamales you may be familiar with, and they also tend to be moister. She‚Äôs selling them for $15 a dozen at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co. Venmo:@yessenia-martinez-25

The last few weeks families have said orders are way down relative to the past year, so please order and SHARE!

Yessenia is selling tamales de rajas con queso this weekend! Her tamales are wrapped in banana leaves, which means they‚Äôre a little bit bigger than the tamales ...you may be familiar with, and they also tend to be moister. She‚Äôs selling them for $15 a dozen at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co.

item.title: As we announced last week, SURJ Denver is raising funds to pay...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

As we announced last week, SURJ Denver is raising funds to pay our friends at Celestial Alegr√≠a to develop a 10-week intensive political education and racial equity training to be delivered this September 2021 for White folks in our community.

Our community will use this curriculum to virtually come together to do the deep work we as white folks need to do to recognize how colonization and racism work together to perpetuate white supremacy, identify where white supremacy sho...ws up within ourselves and others, and gain tools to disrupt and confront it.

During May and June, we will work to reach our fundraising goal of $7,000, 100% of which will go directly to Celestial Alegr√≠a's consultants as payment for developing this curriculum. Any additional funds raised will be used for scholarships to help defray costs for fall workshop attendees. Look for posts and other social media content as the fundraiser progresses!

Donate:
1. Through Denver SURJ‚Äôs fiscal sponsor Centro Humanitario Para Los Trabajadores (please add a note ‚ÄúFor Denver SURJ Ed Fundraiser‚Äù -- this donation is tax deductible) via:
-Their Colorado Gives page: https://www.coloradogives.org/index.php‚Ä¶
-Their PayPal: http://paypal.me/CentroHumanitario

2. To @surjdenver on Venmo (please add a note ‚ÄúFor Denver SURJ Ed Fundraiser"). NOTE: any funds donated via Venmo will be transferred to El Centro monthly. While this method is easier, because it does not go through El Centro, it is not tax deductible, and you will not receive a donation letter or receipt from El Centro.

3. Sign up to express your interest and which of the days/times would be preferable (and let us know if you donated!): https://forms.gle/HugNq4JcgUMN49Fu8

If you don't already, please like and follow @Celestial Alegr√≠a contribute to their Reparations Network, and stay tuned for more info about the training and the fabulous consultants who will be developing it!

See More
item.author: SURJ Denver

item.title: Gaby from Sanctuary4All Colorado is selling burritos de raja...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Gaby from Sanctuary4All Colorado is selling burritos de raja ($7) and chicken tinga ($13) this weekend! The burritos have peppers and cheese and come with a side of beans and salad, and the chicken tinga is shredded chicken cooked in tomato and chipotle chilis with an adobo base, served with rice and beans.

Pickup is n Denver and Boulder on May 22 from 1:00 to 3:00.
Venmo @Gabriela-Miranda-42.

...

Gaby has been supporting her children on her own since her husband was deported last year‚Äîa difficult task at any time, but it‚Äôs been especially challenging due to COVID, as she‚Äôs seen her hours cut. Buy some delicious food and support Gaby's family - 100% of proceeds, as always, go directly to the family whose food you purchase!

You can order at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co.

See MoreSanctuary4All Colorado is in Denver, Colorado.

Gaby is selling burritos and chicken tinga next weekend! She‚Äôs been supporting her children on her own since her husband was deported last year‚Äîa difficult task... at any time, but it‚Äôs been especially challenging due to COVID, as she‚Äôs seen her hours cut. Gaby is a private person and reluctant to share photos of herself and her family on social media, but she‚Äôs just as deserving of support. Please like and share this image throughout the week. You can order at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co.

item.title: There are still seats available for this incredible workshop...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

There are still seats available for this incredible workshop from Soul 2 Soul Sisters that will go deep into the nature of reparations as a form of repair! Learn directly from people who have been doing the work so you can make reparations a part of your regular anti-racism practice.

Sign up now!

Soul 2 Soul Sisters

‚ÄºÔ∏èHeads-up beloved, important information about tomorrow event!

Join healer, poet and racial justice facilitator Norma Johnson and reparations advocate Lotte L...ieb Dula for an evening of exploration into the nature of repair. We‚Äôll navigate the movement for reparations from different directions in an effort to define just what ails our country and what change is needed to facilitate truth-telling and bring about true equity and healing. Lotte will uncover erased history, outlining the source of the racial wealth gap and outlining the economic basis for reparations using her family‚Äôs history of slaveholding as a backdrop. Norma will take us deeply into an African American narrative experience. With plenty of time to drop into our bodies and feel, plus breakout sessions for processing, come prepared for an intense evening of discovery.

‚ÄºÔ∏èDetails!
Date: 05/19/2021
Time: 5:00 - 6:30 PM MST
Where: Zoom!
Register here: https://actionnetwork.org/‚Ä¶/reparations-an-exploration-into‚Ä¶

We hope to see you there! üòç

item.author: SURJ Denver
